column4: Hey! I have a serious Karmic issue! When my display goes to sleep, nothing whatsoever that I do will bring it back up! Why is this happening?
do you havee ati graphics and do you have compiz enabled?
To the best of my knowledge, yes to both questions.
disable the desktop effects (compiz) and see if still occurs
in System>Appearance>Visual effects..
set to none'
I know. I just don't have a way to put to sleep on command.
system>shut down>suspend
that work?
Nope. It's like the computer totally ignores the fact that I have a keyboard and mouse hooked up.
to wake frpom sleep hit the power button...
I did. It had the same problem, though, with merely the display being asleep; I'm supposed to be able to wake the computer up with the keyboard or mouse, but it's not working for me.
what ati drivers you using and where did u get them?
I'm... using Karmic's defaults. If that doesn't answer your question, what do I need to do to give you the rest of the answer?
look in System>administration>hardware drivers and see if you have ATI that you can activate
Nothing.
do this in a terminal... lshw -C video    the C is capital, and tell me what the manufacturer is
Damn, I'm not using ATI after all. This computer uses Intel, it seems.
for now, i'd disable the display sleep, but i'd look through the bugs ans on the forums and if you find nothing then file a bug report,,, if you need help to disable the display sleep, let me know
Nah, one of the first things I did when I noticed this problem was display the sleep. Thanks for your help, though.
have you tried hitting "esc" while display sleep?
Yes.

not to push,,, but i work at HP on the Linux team and we constantly test these types of power management issues constantly... surprisingly intel graphics has the least issues,,, ati the most, and add compiz and more issues,,, i would be interested in seeing more if you get the info
It's no problem. If I learn anything else, I'll try to pass it on to you.
